summary: An internal DOJ email from Public Affairs Officer Nicholas Biase summarizing a media conference call where it was stated the FBI had located Ghislaine Maxwell and that her arrest/charges were imminent due to a statutory deadline. The email also notes two meetings with victims held in NYC and Florida.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: Author of the internal DOJ email summarizing a media conference call about the status of the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Stated to have been located by the FBI, with arrest and/or charges described as imminent due to a looming statutory deadline.

events.title: Media Conference Call on Maxwell Investigation
events.description: A media conference call was held where a spokesperson stated the FBI had located Ghislaine Maxwell and that arrest/charges were imminent, citing a statutory deadline.

events.title: Victim Meetings with Law Enforcement
events.description: Two meetings with victims were held with law enforcement, one in New York City and one in Florida.

keyFacts: The FBI had located Ghislaine Maxwell as of October 8, 2019.
Arrest and/or charges against Ghislaine Maxwell were described as 'imminent' due to a looming statutory deadline.
Two meetings between law enforcement and victims had been held, one in New York City and one in Florida.
